document.title: Making the context tool independent from the editor
document.paragraph:
By default,
../../reference/20_editor/00_introduction.xml the editor and the
../../reference/05_general_interface_description/20_eiffelstudio_window_overview.xml context tool are
../20_browsing/20_viewing_information_about_a_component/10_centering_tools_on_a_component.xml centered on the same cluster, class or feature. It is possible to make the context tool independent from the editor. It has then its own address bar and can display information on a totally different component than the one on which the editor is centered. To do so, click on or select Isolate context tool in the View menu. To go back to the previous configuration, click on the same icon again or select Merge context tool in the View menu.
You can also modify the
../../reference/85_preferences/00_introduction.xml preferences so that next time a window is opened, its context tool will be automatically independent: open the
../../reference/85_preferences/10_overview.xml preferences window by choosing Preferences... in the Tools menu. Select then the "context tool" sub-category in the "Tools" of the preferences tree. Lastly click on "Share addresses between the editor and the context tool" and set it to False. Click on save and exit to complete the change.
